byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and JUDITH H. DOBRZYNSKI

abstract: Graham Bowley Inside Art column; rapper Drake chooses music for Sotheby's exhibition of contemporary works by black American artists; Phillips auction house will sell about 140 works from large private collection, estimated to be highest valued consignment since Edward Dolman took over as chief executive; four new trustees are named to board of Dia Art Foundation; Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville, Ark, acquires 16 works to fill out its postwar collection.
lead_paragraph: The rapper will choose music to preview art in a selling exhibition of contemporary works by black American artists at Sotheby’s.

headline.main: Sotheby’s to Team Up With Drake
headline.print_headline: Sales by Sotheby’s, Music by Drake

snippet: The rapper will choose music to preview art in a selling exhibition of contemporary works by black American artists at Sotheby’s.
